alert.note: Alert for East Baton Rouge; Northern Livingston (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 21 at 4:40PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...A area of strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Livingston and central East Baton Rouge Parishes through 515 PM CDT... At 439 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms over Shenandoah, or near Denham Springs, moving north at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Baton Rouge, Baker, Denham Springs, Oak Hills Place, Westminster, Old Jefferson, Merrydale, Village St. George, Inniswold, Shenandoah, Watson and Brownfields. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 162 and 166. Interstate 12 between mile markers 2 and 13. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
